name: Ada Lovelace
title: The First Computer Programmer
livesSummary: An English mathematician and writer, chiefly known for her work on Charles Babbage's proposed mechanical general-purpose computer, the Analytical Engine. She is often regarded as one of the first computer programmers.
reasonBehindTitle: She was the first to recognize that the machine had applications beyond pure calculation, and published the first algorithm intended to be carried out by such a machine.
lessons: Foresight and imagination can reveal the true potential of new technologies beyond their creators' original intent.
youtubeTitle: The Enchantress of Numbers: Ada Lovelace's Vision

name: The Wright Brothers
title: The First to Achieve Powered Flight
livesSummary: Orville and Wilbur Wright were two American aviation pioneers generally credited with inventing, building, and flying the world's first successful motor-operated airplane.
reasonBehindTitle: On December 17, 1903, they made the first controlled, sustained flight of a powered, heavier-than-air aircraft with the Wright Flyer, heralding the age of aviation.
lessons: Meticulous research, persistent experimentation, and a strong partnership can turn seemingly impossible dreams into reality.
youtubeTitle: Against the Wind: The Wright Brothers' Triumph

name: Hedy Lamarr
title: The Inventor of Frequency-Hopping
livesSummary: An Austrian-American actress and inventor. During her film career, she was a major contract star of MGM's 'Golden Age'. She was also a self-taught inventor and co-developed a 'Secret Communication System' to combat Nazis in WWII.
reasonBehindTitle: Her invention of frequency-hopping spread spectrum technology was a precursor to modern Wi-Fi, GPS, and Bluetooth technology.
lessons: Talent and intellect are not confined to one field. A beautiful mind can be the most powerful tool.
youtubeTitle: The Bombshell and the Brain: Hedy Lamarr's Secret
